"I cannot say exactly if the former CEO was qualified but I can estimate he had the capacity," Kibe told the committee yesterday. 
Makueni Senator Mutula Kilonzo Jnr asked the KCAA management if Naikuni and CEO Mbuvi Ngunze were appointed as per the Civil Aviation Authority Act, 2013. 
Kilonzo said the accountable officer should have background in a management position in the industry. 
Naikuni served as permanent secretary in the Transport ministry and was a member of the Board of Kenya Airways.
